Final Year Automation Project

Completed: June 2025 Duration: 6 months
Siemens TIA Portal HMI SCADA

Project Overview

This final year project involved designing and building a complete custom machine for research on insulated panels. The machine was developed to test thermal properties and structural integrity of various insulation materials used in construction and industrial applications.

Key Features

  • Automated testing sequences for thermal conductivity
  • Precision temperature control and monitoring
  • Data logging and analysis capabilities
  • Safety interlocks and emergency stop systems
  • User-friendly HMI interface for operators

Technical Implementation

The system was built using Siemens S7-1200 PLC with TIA Portal for programming and configuration. The HMI interface was developed using WinCC Basic for operator interaction and real-time monitoring of test parameters.

System Components

  • Siemens S7-1200 PLC for main control logic
  • Temperature sensors and control modules
  • Pneumatic actuators for sample positioning
  • Data acquisition system for measurements

Challenges and Solutions

Challenge: Precise Temperature Control

Maintaining stable temperatures across different test zones while minimizing thermal interference.

Solution: Implemented PID control algorithms with zone-specific heating elements and thermal isolation barriers.

Results and Impact

±0.1°C
Temperature Accuracy
50+
Samples Tested
95%
Test Repeatability

Project Details

Institution: Henallux
Role: Lead Developer
